reviewText: Although both the DVD and its container indicated that this was "Laurel and Hardy Rarities," the DVD I received contained a Charlie Chaplin film. The DVD was immediately returned.

The photo on the cover is very mis-leading, showing a Laurel & Hardy from the 1940's. This early silent movie only features Ollie in character as the cowardly lion. You will not recognize him, and you may be disappointed if you are looking for a Laurel & Hardy comedy. This is pure OZ fantasy. Since this DVD is not formatted for U.S. players, most U.S. buyers should pruchase the NTSC DVDs for reagion 1: The Wizard of Oz The World of Oz It is also a bonus on the deluxe 3-disc Warner release of The Wizard Of Oz DVD set: The Wizard of Oz (Three-Disc Collector's Edition)
